commentary_on_process:
To solve the problem, I looked at the racial makeup of the city and identified the percentage of people who were not Pacific Islander. Since the sum of all the percentages adds up to 100%, I subtracted the percentage of people who were Pacific Islander from 100% to get the percentage of people who were not Pacific Islander. The calculation is as follows: 

100% - 0.1% (Pacific Islander) = 99.9%

To solve the problem better, I could have used the actual numbers of people instead of percentages to calculate the answer. This would have given a more accurate representation of the population.
problem_text:
Context:
As of the census of 2000, there were 197,790 people, 84,549 households, and 43,627 families residing in the city. The population density was 3,292.6 people per square mile (1,271.3/km²). There were 92,282 housing units at an average density of 1,536.2 per square mile (593.1/km²). The racial makeup of the city was 57.2% African American (U.S. Census), 38.3% White (U.S. Census), 0.2% Native American (U.S. Census), 1.3% Asian (U.S. Census), 0.1% Pacific Islander (U.S. Census), 1.5% from Race (United States Census), and 1.5% from two or more races. Hispanic (U.S. Census) or Latino (U.S. Census) of any race were 2.6% of the population.

Question:
How many percent of people were not Pacific Islander?
question_alone: How many percent of people were not Pacific Islander?

steps.step_response: The information relevant to the problem is the racial makeup of the city, specifically the percentage of people who were not Pacific Islander.

steps.step_response:
To solve the problem, I looked at the racial makeup of the city and identified the percentage of people who were not Pacific Islander. Since the sum of all the percentages adds up to 100%, I subtracted the percentage of people who were Pacific Islander from 100% to get the percentage of people who were not Pacific Islander. The calculation is as follows: 

100% - 0.1% (Pacific Islander) = 99.9%

To solve the problem better, I could have used the actual numbers of people instead of percentages to calculate the answer. This would have given a more accurate representation of the population.
